self.philbrown.AbLE.annotations
Class ClassAnnotationInflater

java.lang.Object
  self.philbrown.AbLE.annotations.ClassAnnotationInflater
Direct Known Subclasses:
EmbedInflater, InvisibleInflater, LayoutAdapterInflater, LayoutInflater, XMLLayoutInflater
public abstract class ClassAnnotationInflater
extends java.lang.Object

Superclass to all annotation-based view inflaters. Provides several methods to simplify the inflation process, including handlers for field and inner classes (child views).

Author:
Phil Brown

setters

public java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.util.Map<java.util.List<java.lang.Class<?>>,java.util.List<java.lang.Object>>> setters
Contains a Collection of setter methods to call once the class is loaded. These have been discovered with the annotation Setter, and will usually contain more than one parameter. Stored as:
 <Method Name, <<parameter classes>, <parameters>>>.

getters

public java.util.Map<java.lang.reflect.Field,java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.util.Map<java.util.List<java.lang.Class<?>>,java.util.List<java.lang.Object>>>> getters
Contains a Collection of getter methods to call once the class is loaded. These have been discovered with the annotation Getter, and will usually contain more than one parameter. Stored as:
 <Field <Method Name, <<parameter classes>, <parameters>>>>.

view

public View view
The view that this class is creating

parent

public ClassAnnotationInflater parent
Provides access to the parent view and the fields declared in the parent layout. This allows binded values to look for variables is parent classes, maintaining the expected variables hierarchy.

Constructor Detail

ClassAnnotationInflater

public ClassAnnotationInflater(AbLEActivity context,
                               ClassAnnotationInflater parent)
Constructor

Parameters:
context - used by child views to create the view and access resources
parent - used to allow access to parent variables and classes, so bound values can use them. The root parent is null.
Method Detail

inflate

public abstract View inflate(java.lang.Class<?> layout)
Inflate the layout. This should follow a general pattern of creating the view (if this is a view-based annotation), then handling fields, bindings, setters, child views (if applicable), then returning the view. For example:
 public View inflate(Class layout)
 {
        MyAnnotation annotation = layout.getAnnotation(MyAnnotation.class);
        
        //Handle annotation attributes here
        view = new View(context);//etc
        if (view == null)
                return null;
        
        handleFields(layout);
        handleInstanceMethods(view);
        handleBindings();
        performSetters(view);
        handleChildViews(layout);
  onLayoutComplete(layout, view);
        return view;
 }

Parameters:
layout - the class to layout as a view, controller, or other object
Returns:
the view that was inflated, or null if no view is used.

getParent

public ClassAnnotationInflater getParent()
Returns:
the ClassAnnotationInflater that contains this ClassAnnotationInflater, or null if none exists.
